jobs.title: Business Development Manager
jobs.description:
Lack of energy access in sub-Saharan Africa is a significant problem, with more than 600 million people currently without mains electricity supply. In Rwanda, 9.5 million people or 81% of the population cannot access mains electricity, which has a negative impact on quality of life and limits people’s chances of achieving economic prosperity.

BBOXX is helping to address this issue by providing off-grid communities in developing countries with affordable energy solutions. BBOXX customers typically use a Pay-As-You-Go payment method, which enables very low-income customers access to electricity at home that they would otherwise not be able to afford. To date BBOXX has installed more than 150,000 systems and provided around 750,000 people with access to energy.

Check out our impact here

Title: Business Development Manager

Reports to: Chief Commercial Officer

Location: Chiswick, London

Role Purpose:

Seek, Create, and manage business development opportunities for BBOXX with a focus on new market expansion (DESCO), BBOXX hardware and software revenue streams.

Maintain competitive intelligence, and be familiar with strategies of business relevant stakeholder groups, building relations as required.

Manage the grant and award pipeline and deliver to targets; build relations with relevant industry stakeholders and enhance the company profile.

Manage Business Development Team to deliver to Targets.

Responsibilities

Lead and develop the growth of pipeline opportunities; drive the growth of new markets and other B2B revenue streams.

Oversee the development of new business; preparation of business cases, proposals and sales contracts, coordinating plans and managing stakeholder relations. Manage the process to qualify and progress opportunities, and a process for continuous development of the function.

Support our Innovation and Engineering teams in driving business cases for new products and opportunities, leading pilots and assessing commercial feasibility;

Engage with the senior management team and local marketing teams to appropriately enhance the profile and external communication of the group in all active markets;

Seek and apply for relevant opportunities such as grants for all BBOXX and partner businesses;

Develop strong internal and external partnerships to effectively support business objectives and manage key stakeholder relations; own business development processes.

Maintain global business intelligence and market insights and strong internal communication.

Build and manage a high performance team.

Requirements

About you

In addition to a lean and driven attitude you should have:

* Business Acumen
* A degree in Business, Engineering or similar discipline
* Proven track record in business development or a similar role
* Can demonstrate a track record of producing and delivering a growth strategy and sales plan in complex industries
* Excellent communication skills with the confidence and ability to deliver formal reports and presentations both internally and externally.

Benefits

Based in Chiswick, London

Competitive salary based on experience

Free breakfasts on Monday morning plus fresh fruit, hot drinks and biscuits every day :)

Regular socials - BBOXX organises monthly social events which can be proposed by anyone on the team. This could be anything from a picnic in the park to laser tag or the regular pub quiz

Every BBOXX team member receives a yearly budget to spend on their own personal development

jobs.title: Country Managing Director
jobs.description:
We are looking for a Country Managing Director or our new entity, with solid commercial and leadership experience to control and oversee all business operations, people and ventures and drive the strategic growth.

The ideal candidate will be a strategist and a leader able to steer the company to the most profitable direction while also creating and implementing high-quality strategy and business plans at the country-level. Very strong analytical and project management skills will also be essential since the GM is the one expected to deliver results and changes necessary.

The goal is to ensure the company is constantly moving towards fulfilling its short-term and long-term objectives and does not diverge from its strategic guidelines. You will be joining a team of 600+ staff across multiple offices in East Africa, China, UK, France and West Africa.

Requirements

Reports to: Country Board

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

 Own the country P&L, and ensure that business outcomes (profitability etc) are always achieved

 Manage the finances of the business, and ensure full audit compliance

 Ensure the business complies with company policies and procedures on, among others, anti-bribery, employment, governance

 Oversee relationships with all business partners in-country

 Represent the brand, and maintain quality service by identifying market trends, analyzing and reviewing best customer service practices etc

 Create, own and implement the commercial strategy for the country

 Implement local pricing models based on customer feedback and business performance targets

 Report on company operations in a timely and accurate manner

 Lead the growth and operations of the retail network by implementing the company’s standard operating model, and setting up hubs & retail outlets in line with growth targets


QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE

 10+ years’ experience in a senior commercial role, preferably within a multinational business (e.g. FMCG, telecoms), with P&L ownership & a track record of delivering consistent bottom-line performance

 Demonstrated assertiveness, a passion for excellence, and a unique ability to build strong relationships internally and externally

 Proven strategic aptitude, with the ability to influence at a senior level internally and externally - Commercial acumen, with strong customer orientation

 Demonstrated track record of leading teams to consistently deliver outperformance

 Very strong analytical, quantitative, problem-solving and project management skills are

required

 First class time management and organizational skills, with a strong ability to prioritize

 Prior experience in a reputable strategy consulting firm (e.g. KPMG, PWC, McKinsey) a distinct advantage

 Proficient in English, french is an added advantage.


CORE COMPETENCIES

 ADAPTABILITY: Flexible, results-oriented, and able to work in a project-driven environment

 PROJECT MANAGEMENT: Multi-tasking, project management and decision-making skills

 INFLUENCE: Strong leadership and influencing skills, with the ability to engage key stakeholders

 ANALYTICAL: Strong analytical and numerical skills, commercial acumen, and MS Excel skills

 CHANGE LEADERSHIP: Demonstrated ability to lead change efforts within an organization

 JUDGEMENT: Good judgment, and the ability to develop credibility across the business

Benefits

1. Competitive market salary and benefits
2. Working with the best people in the sector and making an impact to the millions of people
3. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status
4. Our relentless commitment to personal development and career growth

Title: Data Engineer

Reporting to: Tech Lead

Location: Chiswick: London

About the role

The Data Insight team has a mission of using data visualisation to effect positive behavioural change in the Next Generation Utilities around the world. We have built a data warehouse to integrate data from across the business and a suite of dashboards on top of it that hundreds of BBOXX’ers, at every level, use to make decisions every day.

We’re a team of 7 sitting in London and Kigali. We work in Scrum agile, using Slack to chat, GitHub for our version control, AWS for our infrastructure, CD/CI with Jenkins and CodeDeploy, JIRA for stories and sprints, Confluence for our docs, Python for our pipelines, PostgreSQL for our Data Warehouse and Power BI for our Dashboards.

Now is the interesting time to join the team as we are building our data science capability to better utilise our data and re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability

Responsibilities

Implementing and improving on best practices regarding software development: unit testing, git flow, deployments (infrastructure as code on AWS)

Optimising and extending the functionality of our Data Insight API and deploying machine learning models in production

Monitoring, improving and implementing the ETL pipelines for data cleansing and ingestion into our data warehouse

Working closely with DBA developer and other teams to improve the data quality and performance of our data warehouse

Collaborate with other teams and stakeholders to assist with data-related technical issues and suggest solutions to fulfil their requirements

Requirements

About you

3+ years’ commercial software development experience with Python.

You have experience writing SQL.

You have experience using or developing web APIs.

You have experience using AWS.

You have experience with data warehouse solutions.

Bonus skills

You have experience with CI/CD tools (Docker, Jenkins, Travis and Serverless being a plus) and workflow scheduling (experience with Apache Airflow being a plus)

You have experience in deploying analytics solutions (machine learning model, clustering, etc) in production

You enjoy collaborating with other teams to optimise our existing systems and provide better solutions to meet future business needs

Benefits

Based in Chiswick, London

Competitive salary based on experience

Free breakfasts on Monday morning plus fresh fruit, hot drinks and biscuits every day :)

Regular socials - BBOXX organises monthly social events which can be proposed by anyone on the team. This could be anything from a picnic in the park to laser tag or the regular pub quiz

Every BBOXX team member receives a yearly budget to spend on their own personal development

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status

Recruitment Agencies - We think its great you would like to partner with us, however, we have an awesome in-house talent team who take care of all things recruitment. Please respect that BBOXX employees have their own jobs to do, so please refrain from calling unannounced or sending unsolicited CVs........not cool.

If we do need to reach out for external support, we will do so.

Please send your company details, areas of speciality to our careers inbox and we will keep a record.

Title: ERP Project Manager

Reports to: Head of Control and Process.

Location: Lisbon, Portugal or Remote

The Role

You are a project owner/manager with a passion for information technology, project management and a belief in BBOXX’s mission. You will report to Head of Control and Process.

You will be part of the cross-continental Supply Chain Control and Process team which focuses on providing analysis of supply chain data, improving processes and information systems development, as well as providing strategic guidance and recommendations to Management.

Duties

As an ERP Systems Project Manager you will be responsible for driving software engineering teams to deliver applications supporting Bboxx Ltd Supply Chain.

Manage Supply Chain Systems - Business Request process, ensuring requests are documented, prioritized and implemented following the approval and timeline process.

Work interactively across Business and IT teams to support development of business solutions.

Lead and facilitate meetings and discussions to elicit business requirements to define and deliver system solutions.

Lead software engineers in developing and maintaining our ERP systems built in OpenERP/Odoo.

Gather requirements from business users, IT professionals, etc.

Write user stories and define acceptance criteria in collaboration with Product Owner.

Work with external consultants on the implementation of integrated supply chain systems solutions.

Plan and execute user acceptance testing (UAT) for developed features on the systems provide precise feedback to software engineers.

Research reported problems, identify causes and develop appropriate solution.

Requirements

Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems Management or Supply Chain

2+ years’ IT related project management

Experience in Supply Chain Systems (ERP)

Track record of software product development, design and architecture

Strong understanding of Business and IT change transformation.

Demonstrated expertise in problem-solving and technical innovation.

Excellent communication skills (verbal and written)

Fluency in English

And ideally should have:

Experience in OpenERP/Odoo framework.

Familiarity with Agile/Scrum

Experience with python programming

Experience working with SQL databases

Benefits

Competitive salary based on experience.

Flexible working hours

Remote working.

Being part of BBOXX's start up culture - fast pace of development, lots of

responsibility, opportunities to learn and implement your own ideas

jobs.title: Expansion Manager
jobs.description:
Job Purpose

The position is tasked with managing NGU customers, building solutions and driving revenue growth for B2B in NGU’s including expansion into new territories. The Expansion team is responsible for managing NGU relations, implementing solutions and driving growth as per agreed business plan. This is a strategic role supporting the commercial objectives and goals of. It is expected that the team will use market knowledge and understanding to feed into the Innovation cycle.

As our B2B business rapidly scales, the Expansion Managers will each be responsible for a set of 3-4 high growth customers across the world. The Expansion manager will be responsible to grow BBOXX revenue in assigned NGU and provide NGU support towards scale and profitability.

Key Responsibilities

* Be the point-of-contact for all B2B customer matters. Understand the customers’ business, markets, end customers and their business strategy, and related risks and mitigation strategy.
* Coach B2B customer MDs/GMs on how to effectively set-up and run a new market operation
* Build and maintain strong, long-lasting B2B client relationships, including onboarding new clients and managing existing relations as required.
* Support the implementation of new products and services in markets.
* Support management of contracts with customers with wider commercial and legal team, including consulting engagements and other business agreements.
* Develop trusted advisor relationships with B2B customer key stakeholders and executive sponsors
* Ensure the timely and successful delivery of BBOXX solutions according to customer needs and objectives
* Clearly communicate the progress of monthly/quarterly initiatives to BBOXX and customer stakeholders
* Develops short & long term forecasting of markets and support customer in ensuring requirements are managed with supply chain.
* Works and coordinates seamlessly with other department managers in order to meet account performance objectives and customer needs
* Conducts market intelligence: provides facts, evaluates, validates interpret, assesses and communicates impacts and recommendations to business strategy.

Requirements

* Bachelor's Degree
* 2-3 years of experience in account or client management
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced, deadline-centric, fun environment.
* Excellent customer orientation and excellent communication skills (writing and presentation)
* Must be PROACTIVE! · A cheerful, roll-up-your-sleeves, get-it-done attitude · Strong knowledge of Ms office Suite · Attention to detail, analytical with strong logical thinking
* Excellent communication, presentation, negotiation, and reporting skills
* Good analytical skills, using data to identify underlying trends to support commercial decisions
* Ability to operate both independently and in a team to lead to objectives and company’s goals
* Approximately 30%-40% of your time expected to travel
* French language skills a key asset.

Benefits

Competitive salary and comprehensive medical insurance

Free lunch at your choice of restaurants

Our relentless commitment to your personal development and career growth

Working with the best people in the sector and making an impact on the lives of millions of people who are currently in the dark

Living in one of the most beautiful parts of East Africa

jobs.title: PhD Studentship: Smart Cooking Solutions for ALL
jobs.description:
UCL Department / Division

Civil, Environmental & Geomatic Engineering

Location -London

Duration of Studentship

3.5 years

Stipend - £17,280 per annum

Vacancy Information

Applications are invited for a PhD studentship jointly funded by BBOXX and UCL Engineering. The studentship is for a full-time doctorate over three and a half years.

The scholarship covers UCL registration fees and provides a stipend of £17,280 per annum tax free. Research equipment and part travel expenses for one trip per annum will also be covered under the funding.

Studentship Description

The lack of access to modern energy services continues to be the reality for over a billion people worldwide. In Sub-Saharan Africa, 65% of the population (37% in urban and over 80% in rural areas) live off the grid and have to rely on polluting fuels such as candles, kerosene, charcoal and wood for lighting and cooking. There is a growing need for research into innovative solutions for making clean cooking fuels accessible.

This research will build on the innovative work of BBOXX (https://www.bboxx.co.uk/ (https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bboxx.co.uk%2F) ), a next generation utility unlocking potential through energy access. With headquarters in London and operations in 12 countries including Rwanda, Kenya, Togo, DRC and Pakistan BBOXX offers pay-as-you-go solar power. At the heart of BBOXX is their pioneering management platform, called Pulse, which continuously collects data and insights. BBOXX are exploring the potential to use their management platforms to enable improved access to LPG to have a positive impact on households who currently use charcoal.

Requirements

Person Specification

The applicants should possess a good honours degree (1st Class or 2:1 minimum) in civil, renewable energy, electrical, energy, environmental engineering discipline with relevant experience in international development and strong writing skills, quantitative and qualitative data analysis skills along with programming skills for Python. We also invite applicants from geography and planning background who can demonstrate relevant engineering and programming experience.

Eligibility

Applications are invited from UK and EU members, residing in UK. Applicants must meet EPSRC eligibility requirements found here
http://www.epsrc.ac.uk/skills/studentships/help/el... (https://workable.com/nr?l=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.epsrc.ac.uk%2Fskills%2Fstudentships%2Fhelp%2Feligibility%2F)

Applicants should send a covering letter and CV to priti.parikh@ucl.ac.uk. The successful applicant will then have to apply online to UCL by submitting the PhD application form, available from www.ucl.ac.uk/civil-environmental-geomatic-engineering/mphil-phd (https://workable.com/nr?l=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.ucl.ac.uk%2Fcivil-environmental-geomatic-engineering%2Fmphil-phd) . Please name Dr. Priti Parikh as the proposed supervisor.


Contact name

Priti Parikh

Contact details

priti.parikh@ucl.ac.uk

Closing Date

21 Jul 2019

Studentship Start Date

1 October 2019

Reports to: Product Manager: BBOXX Power DC

Location: Kigali, Rwanda (with some travel to China and other locations)

Role Purpose: This role is responsible for managing the full life cycle of appliances used with BBOXXs solar home systems. This includes developing new appliance ideas, writing user requirements, coordinating with the sourcing team, and managing the rollout of new appliances.

ABOUT THE ROLE:

Defining the requirements for appliances:

* Working with the research team and other product managers to identify new appliance ideas and evaluate their feasibility and impact
* Conducting research to identify key requirements, demand, etc. for new appliances
* Compiling user requirements and technical requirements for new appliances

Coordinating the sourcing process for all appliances:

* Working with the sourcing team in China to source and test appliances that meet the technical requirements identified
* Conducting any field tests needed to evaluate the suitability of potential appliances

Managing the rollout of new appliances:

* Coordinating with other teams to create marketing documents, sales strategies, prices, and repair manuals for new appliances
* Compiling product packs that contain all of the information that country offices need to know to rollout new appliances
* Working with country teams to organize the first rollouts of new appliances to ensure that they go smoothly

Monitoring appliance performance and managing the appliance life cycle:

* Coordinating with the technical teams to monitor appliance failure rates and customer satisfaction with existing appliances
* Suggesting updates to appliances and coordinating with the sourcing team to make these changes
* Evaluating when the right time is to stop producing an appliance and coordinating this process

Requirements

* Bachelors degree, preferably in product design or mechanical engineering
* 2+ years of experience in product design, product management, or a similar field

* Creative flair, conceptual/visual ability, and originality

* Ability to work under pressure, and in a flexible manner
* Ability to interact, communicate and present ideas effectively at all levels of an organization

* Up to date with the latest consumer electronics technologies, and experience in consumer electronics preferred

* Experience with business models and basic financial analysis a plus
* Experience conducting human-centered design research and a love for uncovering customer needs

Benefits

* Competitive salary and regional/international medical insurance
* Our relentless commitment to personal development and career growth
* Company-sponsored lunch at select restaurants
* Working with the best people in the sector and making an impact to the millions of people living in the dark
* Living and working in one of the most beautiful parts of East Africa and travelling to other parts of the continent and beyond

Title: Regional Chief Financial Officer (CFO)

The role requires a CFO to work across three next generation utility (NGU) companies located in Kenya, Rwanda and the DRC. Financial Management

* Perform risk management by analyzing the organization’s liabilities and investments.
* Evaluate and support the company’s fundraising plans and capital structure.
* Ensure and optimize cash flow.
* Financial accounting and controls.
* Ensure compliance with all shareholder, lender and government agreements.
* Work with senior leaders at BBOXX and AIIM.
* Prepare budgets and forecasts, and financial reports for management, shareholders and lenders for monitoring performance against budget/forecast.
* Preparation of quarterly updates to the financial model and working with lenders in order to comply with loan covenants and reporting.
* Audit liaison and preparation of annual and quarterly financial statements.
* Prepare information for NGU board packs; investor updates, investment committees, project updates and other ad hoc financial reporting information.

* Liaison with and management of service providers.
* Advice on and review of finance-related matters (distributions, cash flows, finance issues).

Lack of energy access in sub-Saharan Africa is a significant problem, with more than 600 million people currently without mains electricity supply.
